data.value: Error submitting the scheduled task. Please make sure you have sufficient rights to perform the task and that the Windows schedule service is started.

data.name: CheckBox_PCExLogon
data.value: For Exchange server access, please specify an account for the {0} to run under. The account should have at least Exchange administrator View Only permissions at the organization level, and be a member of the built-in administrators group on each Exchange server.

data.name: Label_PExCredError
data.value: Error validating Exchange logon credentials. Please try entering a different set of credentials.

data.name: Label_SHNotAllowedNotLocalAdmin
data.value: Runs cannot be scheduled because you are not logged on as a local administrator.

data.name: Label_SSScopeSummaryAG
data.value: Scope is set to the {0} administration group. This administration group contains {1} Exchange servers.

data.name: Label_PADCredError
data.value: Error validating Active Directory logon credentials. Please try entering a different set of credentials.

data.name: Label_SSScopeWithOrg
data.value: Scope is set to {0} server(s), {1} administration group(s), and the organization.

data.name: Label_CSLabel
data.value: Enter the label for this compare or select an existing one:

data.name: Label_PDesc
data.value: The {0} is verifying that you have network connectivity and permissions to access Active Directory. The tool needs read access to the Active Directory schema as well as to the Configuration and Users containers. The tool also requires read access to each domain controller, global catalog server and Exchange server that will be scanned. These permissions will be checked after you select where the scan will run.

data.name: Label_WDesc
data.value:
This is the Best Pratice Analyzer. It can be used to test configuration files and also servers as a skeleton for creating other BPA's.
. Click the "Select an Analyzer" button to load and analyzer and begin scanning.

data.name: Label_DDesc
data.value: The latest configuration file is being downloaded from {0}. The configuration file contains all the properties that the {1} retrieves and all of the rules it uses to analyze those properties. The configuration file is updated frequently as system changes occur and refinements are made to improve the analysis output.

data.name: LinkLabel_VSDisableAll
data.value: Do not show me this item again for all instances.

data.name: Label_CDesc
data.value: The {0} is connecting to {1} to check for updates. There may be updates to the tool, or there may be updates to the configuration file. The configuration file contains all the properties that this tool retrieves and all of the rules it uses to analyze those properties. The configuration file is updated frequently and can be downloaded, installed, and used without restarting the tool. If a newer version of the tool is found, you will need to update and restart the tool.

data.name: Label_DPleaseWait
data.value: Please wait while the latest updates are being downloaded.

data.name: LinkLabel_VSMoreNonError
data.value: Tell me more about this setting.

data.name: Error_FileAlreadyExists
data.value: A file already exists with the same name as the file being imported.

data.name: Label_NVDescNewConfig
data.value: A new version of the configuration file has been found. {0}

data.name: Label_SSScopeSummaryServer
data.value: Scope is set to server {0} only.

data.name: LinkLabel_SEScanEntryViewScan
data.value: View a report of this scan

data.name: Label_NVDescNewVersion
data.value: A new version of the tool has been found. {0}

data.name: Label_ConfigFileOld
data.value: The configuration file is too old to be run by this version of the {0}. Please download a new version from {0}.

data.name: Label_PNoOrgFoundError
data.value: No Exchange organization container found in domain.

data.name: Label_PCDesc
data.value: The {0} must have read access to Active Directory. By default the tool will use the currently logged-on account, and will automatically find and connect to a suitable global catalog server. The account that you are logged on with will also need administrator or equivalent access to each Exchange server.

data.name: Label_DVPleaseWait
data.value: Please wait while the latest version of this tool is being downloaded.

data.name: LinkLabel_WSelectOptions
data.value: Select options for a new scan

data.name: Label_SSSelectType
data.value: Select the type of scan to perform:

data.name: Label_SHDesc
data.value: Scans can be configured to run on a scheduled basis. If this option is enabled, scans with the currently specified parameters will run at the specified interval. If this application is closed, scans will continue to run. The output can be examined by restarting this UI.

data.name: Label_PCCreds
data.value: To run the {0} under different accounts, click "Show advanced login options."

data.name: LinkLabel_NVUpdateVersion
data.value: Update the tool in place (you will need to restart the tool when this completes)

data.name: RadioButton_UOEnableSQM
data.value: Join the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program

data.name: Sample_Description
data.value: This is a sample error message.

data.name: CheckBox_PCADLogon
data.value: For Active Directory server access, please specify an account for the {0} to run under. The account should have computer-level administrator or equivalent permissions to each global catalog server.

data.name: Label_DVDesc
data.value: The latest version of the {0} is being downloaded from {1}. When the download completes, the tool will close and you will need to restart it.

data.name: Error_FileNotFound
data.value: Specified data file does not exist.

data.name: Label_PCDC
data.value: If you are running the {0} in a different domain or want to specify a different global catalog server for the tool to connect to, enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the global catalog server here:

data.name: RadioButton_UODisableUpdates
data.value: Do not check for updates on startup

data.name: Label_SETitle
data.value: Select a Best Practices Scan to View

data.name: Label_IPStartError
data.value: Error running the scan. Please try again.

data.name: Button_StartScan
data.value: Start a new Best Practices scan

data.name: Label_SSBaselineDesc
data.value: When selecting a baseline scan, instead of checking the standard best practices, this tool will compare a pre-defined set of properties between selected sets of servers. For each control server selected, this tool will generate a report that shows all the differences found in the selected servers to be compared to that control server.

data.name: Label_UOSQMDescription
data.value:
Do you want to join the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program?
The program sends to Microsoft anonymous information about your computer hardware and how you use our product, without interrupting you or your users. This helps us identify which features to improve. If you choose to join, this data will be collected from all servers this tool scans. No information collected is used to identify or contact you.

data.name: LinkLabel_WSelectScan
data.value: Select a Best Practices scan to view

data.name: Label_SSBaselineTargets
data.value: Select the servers to be compared to the currently selected control server:

data.name: Label_CSDesc
data.value: This tool can compare settings between two objects in the same run or different runs. It can also compare object settings to a set of values.

data.name: Label_GVPleaseWait
data.value: Please wait while the {0} prepares the scan for viewing.

data.name: Label_UODescription
data.value: The following options control whether this tool will automatically check the Web for a newer version of the configuration or the tool upon startup. Leave this enabled unless you are having repeated connection difficulties or are running in a closed network. If this is disabled, you can still check for updates on demand using the "{0}" link on the left pane, or you can manually install updates. Instructions for manually installing updates can be found in the help file.
